	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">2014 United States House of Representatives elections</h1>
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"></div>
		<div id="contentSub2"></div>
		
		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">House elections for the 114th U.S. Congress</div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">For related races, see <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_elections" title="2014 United States elections">2014 United States elections</a>.</div>

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:transparent; width:100%;">
<tbody><tr>
<td style="width:50%; text-align:left;"><b><a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives">Speaker</a> before election</b><br />
<p><a href="/wiki/John_Boehner" title="John Boehner">John Boehner</a><br />
<a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_(US)" class="mw-redirect" title="Republican Party (US)">Republican</a>
</p>
</td>
<td style="width:50%; text-align:right;"><b>Elected <a href="/wiki/Speaker_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="Speaker of the United States House of Representatives">Speaker</a></b> <br />
<p><a href="/wiki/John_Boehner" title="John Boehner">John Boehner</a><br />
<a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_(US)" class="mw-redirect" title="Republican Party (US)">Republican</a>
</p>
</td></tr></tbody></table></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>The <b>2014 United States House of Representatives elections</b> were held on November 4, 2014, in the middle of President <a href="/wiki/Barack_Obama" title="Barack Obama">Barack Obama</a>'s second term in office. Elections were held for all 435 seats of the <a href="/wiki/United_States_House_of_Representatives" title="United States House of Representatives">House of Representatives</a>, representing the 50 <a href="/wiki/U.S._state" title="U.S. state">states</a>. Elections were also held for the <a href="/wiki/Delegate_(United_States_Congress)" class="mw-redirect" title="Delegate (United States Congress)">non-voting delegates</a> from the <a href="/wiki/District_of_Columbia" class="mw-redirect" title="District of Columbia">District of Columbia</a> and four of the five <a href="/wiki/Insular_area" title="Insular area">territories</a>. The winners of these elections served in the <a href="/wiki/114th_United_States_Congress" title="114th United States Congress">114th United States Congress</a>, with seats apportioned among the states based on the <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_Census" class="mw-redirect" title="2010 United States Census">2010 United States Census</a>. The Republicans won 16 seats from Democrats, while three Republican-held seats turned Democratic. The Republicans achieved their largest majority in the House since <a href="/wiki/1928_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="1928 United States House of Representatives elections">1928</a> due to a sizeable Republican wave. Combined with the Republican gains made in <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="2010 United States House of Representatives elections">2010</a>, the total number of Democratic-held House seats lost under <a href="/wiki/Barack_Obama" title="Barack Obama">Barack Obama</a>'s presidency in <a href="/wiki/United_States_midterm_election" title="United States midterm election">midterm elections</a> rose to 77 with these elections. This marked the highest number of House seats lost under a two-term president of the same party since <a href="/wiki/Harry_S._Truman" title="Harry S. Truman">Harry S. Truman</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> With 36.4% of eligible voters voting, the <a href="/wiki/Voter_turnout" title="Voter turnout">voter turnout</a> was the lowest since <a href="/wiki/1942_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections" title="1942 United States House of Representatives elections">1942</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup>
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Incumbents_who_retired">Incumbents who retired</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Incumbents who retired">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:402px;"><a href="/wiki/File:114th_US_Congress_House.png" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b7/114th_US_Congress_House.png/400px-114th_US_Congress_House.png" decoding="async" width="400" height="229" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b7/114th_US_Congress_House.png/600px-114th_US_Congress_House.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b7/114th_US_Congress_House.png/800px-114th_US_Congress_House.png 2x" data-file-width="1080" data-file-height="618" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:114th_US_Congress_House.png" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>House seats by party holding plurality in state</div></div></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:402px;"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2014_open_seats.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/US_House_2014_open_seats.svg/400px-US_House_2014_open_seats.svg.png" decoding="async" width="400" height="232" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/US_House_2014_open_seats.svg/600px-US_House_2014_open_seats.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/63/US_House_2014_open_seats.svg/800px-US_House_2014_open_seats.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1242" data-file-height="720" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2014_open_seats.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Open seats highlighted by party.<br /> <b>Democratic-held seats</b>: <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#008; color:#008;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Retired</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#ccf; color:#ccf;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Not retired</span><br /> <b>Republican-held seats</b>: <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#800; color:#800;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Retired</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#fcc; color:#fcc;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Not retired</span></div></div></div>
<p>Forty-one representatives retired from their seats.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Democrats">Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Sixteen Democrats (seventeen, including the delegate from the Virgin Islands) retired from their seats.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Arizona07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arizona%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Arizona&#39;s 7th congressional district">Arizona&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ed_Pastor" title="Ed Pastor">Ed Pastor</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Pastor_6-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Pastor-6">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 11th congressional district">California&#160;11</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/George_Miller_(California_politician)" title="George Miller (California politician)">George Miller</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-George_Miller_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-George_Miller-7">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California33&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_33rd_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 33rd congressional district">California&#160;33</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Henry_Waxman" title="Henry Waxman">Henry Waxman</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Waxman_retirement_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Waxman_retirement-8">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California35&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_35th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 35th congressional district">California&#160;35</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Gloria_Negrete_McLeod" title="Gloria Negrete McLeod">Gloria Negrete McLeod</a>: Retired to run for the <a href="/wiki/San_Bernardino_County,_California" title="San Bernardino County, California">San Bernardino County</a> <a href="/wiki/Board_of_Supervisors" class="mw-redirect" title="Board of Supervisors">Board of Supervisors</a><sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Hawaii01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Hawaii%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Hawaii&#39;s 1st congressional district">Hawaii&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Colleen_Hanabusa" title="Colleen Hanabusa">Colleen Hanabusa</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_special_election_in_Hawaii" title="2014 United States Senate special election in Hawaii">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Iowa01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Iowa%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Iowa&#39;s 1st congressional district">Iowa&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Braley" title="Bruce Braley">Bruce Braley</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Iowa" title="2014 United States Senate election in Iowa">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Maine02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Maine%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Maine&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Maine&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_Michaud" title="Mike Michaud">Mike Michaud</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_Maine_gubernatorial_election" title="2014 Maine gubernatorial election">run for Governor of Maine</a><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan12&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_12th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 12th congressional district">Michigan&#160;12</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_Dingell" title="John Dingell">John Dingell</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Dingell_Politico_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Dingell_Politico-13">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan14&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_14th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 14th congressional district">Michigan&#160;14</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Gary_Peters" title="Gary Peters">Gary Peters</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Michigan" title="2014 United States Senate election in Michigan">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Jersey12&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Jersey%27s_12th_congressional_district" title="New Jersey&#39;s 12th congressional district">New Jersey&#160;12</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Rush_Holt_Jr." title="Rush Holt Jr.">Rush Holt Jr.</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Holt_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Holt-15">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 4th congressional district">New York&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Carolyn_McCarthy" title="Carolyn McCarthy">Carolyn McCarthy</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-McCarthy-McIntyre_16-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-McCarthy-McIntyre-16">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York21&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_21st_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 21st congressional district">New York&#160;21</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bill_Owens_(New_York_politician)" title="Bill Owens (New York politician)">Bill Owens</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="North Carolina07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/North_Carolina%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="North Carolina&#39;s 7th congressional district">North Carolina&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_McIntyre" title="Mike McIntyre">Mike McIntyre</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-McCarthy-McIntyre_16-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-McCarthy-McIntyre-16">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Pennsylvania13&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania%27s_13th_congressional_district" title="Pennsylvania&#39;s 13th congressional district">Pennsylvania&#160;13</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Allyson_Schwartz" title="Allyson Schwartz">Allyson Schwartz</a>: Retired to run for <a href="/wiki/2014_Pennsylvania_gubernatorial_election" title="2014 Pennsylvania gubernatorial election">Governor of Pennsylvania</a><sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Utah04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Utah%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Utah&#39;s 4th congressional district">Utah&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jim_Matheson" title="Jim Matheson">Jim Matheson</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Matheson_retirement_19-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Matheson_retirement-19">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/United_States_Virgin_Islands%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="United States Virgin Islands&#39;s at-large congressional district">Virgin Islands</a>: <a href="/wiki/Donna_Christian-Christensen" title="Donna Christian-Christensen">Donna Christian-Christensen</a>: Retired to run for <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Virgin_Islands_gubernatorial_election" title="2014 United States Virgin Islands gubernatorial election">Governor of the Virgin Islands</a>.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia08&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_8th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 8th congressional district">Virginia&#160;8</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jim_Moran" title="Jim Moran">Jim Moran</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Moran_retirement_20-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Moran_retirement-20">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup></li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Republicans">Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Twenty-five Republicans retired from their seats.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Alabama06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Alabama%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Alabama&#39;s 6th congressional district">Alabama&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Spencer_Bachus" title="Spencer Bachus">Spencer Bachus</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-Bachus_21-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bachus-21">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Arkansas02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arkansas%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Arkansas&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Arkansas&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tim_Griffin" title="Tim Griffin">Tim Griffin</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_Arkansas_elections#Lieutenant_Governor" title="2014 Arkansas elections">run for Lieutenant Governor of Arkansas</a><sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Arkansas04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arkansas%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Arkansas&#39;s 4th congressional district">Arkansas&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tom_Cotton" title="Tom Cotton">Tom Cotton</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Arkansas" title="2014 United States Senate election in Arkansas">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California25&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_25th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 25th congressional district">California&#160;25</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Buck_McKeon" title="Buck McKeon">Buck McKeon</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California31&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_31st_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 31st congressional district">California&#160;31</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Gary_Miller" title="Gary Miller">Gary Miller</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="California45&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_45th_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 45th congressional district">California&#160;45</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_B._T._Campbell_III" title="John B. T. Campbell III">John B. T. Campbell III</a>: Retired<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Colorado04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Colorado%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Colorado&#39;s 4th congressional district">Colorado&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Cory_Gardner" title="Cory Gardner">Cory Gardner</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Colorado" title="2014 United States Senate election in Colorado">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Georgia01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Georgia%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Georgia&#39;s 1st congressional district">Georgia&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jack_Kingston" title="Jack Kingston">Jack Kingston</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Georgia" title="2014 United States Senate election in Georgia">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Georgia10&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Georgia%27s_10th_congressional_district" title="Georgia&#39;s 10th congressional district">Georgia&#160;10</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Paul_Broun" title="Paul Broun">Paul Broun</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Georgia" title="2014 United States Senate election in Georgia">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Georgia11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Georgia%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="Georgia&#39;s 11th congressional district">Georgia&#160;11</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Phil_Gingrey" title="Phil Gingrey">Phil Gingrey</a>: Retired to <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_Senate_election_in_Georgia" title="2014 United States Senate election in Georgia">run for U.S. Senator</a><sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Incumbents_defeated">Incumbents defeated</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Incumbents defeated">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg/220px-US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="128" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg/330px-US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg/440px-US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1242" data-file-height="720" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2014_defeated_incumbents.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Defeated incumbents by party.<br /> <b>Democratic-held seats</b>: <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#00f; color:#00f;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Defeated in primary</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#008; color:#008;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Defeated in general</span><br /> <b>Republican-held seats</b>: <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#f00; color:#f00;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Defeated in primary</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#800; color:#800;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Defeated in general</span></div></div></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="In_primary_elections">In primary elections</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: In primary elections">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Louisiana05&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Louisiana%27s_5th_congressional_district" title="Louisiana&#39;s 5th congressional district">Louisiana&#160;5</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Vance_McAllister" title="Vance McAllister">Vance McAllister</a> (R) lost a <a href="/wiki/Nonpartisan_blanket_primary" title="Nonpartisan blanket primary">Nonpartisan blanket primary</a> to <a href="/wiki/Jamie_Mayo" title="Jamie Mayo">Jamie Mayo</a> (D) and <a href="/wiki/Ralph_Abraham_(politician)" title="Ralph Abraham (politician)">Ralph Abraham</a> (R). Abraham then won the runoff. Republican hold.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Massachusetts06&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Massachusetts%27s_6th_congressional_district" title="Massachusetts&#39;s 6th congressional district">Massachusetts&#160;6</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_F._Tierney" title="John F. Tierney">John F. Tierney</a> (D) lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Seth_Moulton" title="Seth Moulton">Seth Moulton</a> (D), who then won the general election. Democratic hold.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Michigan11&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Michigan%27s_11th_congressional_district" title="Michigan&#39;s 11th congressional district">Michigan&#160;11</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Kerry_Bentivolio" title="Kerry Bentivolio">Kerry Bentivolio</a> (R) lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/David_Trott" class="mw-redirect" title="David Trott">David Trott</a> (R),<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup> who then won the general election. Republican hold.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 4th congressional district">Texas&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ralph_Hall" title="Ralph Hall">Ralph Hall</a> (R), lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/John_Ratcliffe_(American_politician)" title="John Ratcliffe (American politician)">John Ratcliffe</a> (R),<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> who then won the general election. Republican hold.</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Virginia07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Virginia%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="Virginia&#39;s 7th congressional district">Virginia&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Eric_Cantor" title="Eric Cantor">Eric Cantor</a> (R) lost renomination to <a href="/wiki/Dave_Brat" title="Dave Brat">Dave Brat</a> (R),<sup id="cite_ref-latimes06112014_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-latimes06112014-48">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> who then won the general election. Republican hold.</li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="In_the_general_election">In the general election</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: In the general election">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Republicans had a net gain of nine seats, taken from Democrats.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Democrats_2">Democrats</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Democrats">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Eleven Democrats (twelve, including the delegate from American Samoa) lost re-election to Republicans.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Arizona02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Arizona%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Arizona&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Arizona&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Ron_Barber" title="Ron Barber">Ron Barber</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Martha_McSally" title="Martha McSally">Martha McSally</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Florida26&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_26th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 26th congressional district">Florida&#160;26</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Joe_Garcia" title="Joe Garcia">Joe Garcia</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Curbelo" title="Carlos Curbelo">Carlos Curbelo</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Georgia12&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Georgia%27s_12th_congressional_district" title="Georgia&#39;s 12th congressional district">Georgia&#160;12</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/John_Barrow_(U.S._politician)" class="mw-redirect" title="John Barrow (U.S. politician)">John Barrow</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Rick_W._Allen" title="Rick W. Allen">Rick W. Allen</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Illinois10&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_10th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 10th congressional district">Illinois&#160;10</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Brad_Schneider" title="Brad Schneider">Brad Schneider</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Bob_Dold" title="Bob Dold">Bob Dold</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Illinois12&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Illinois%27s_12th_congressional_district" title="Illinois&#39;s 12th congressional district">Illinois&#160;12</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/William_Enyart" title="William Enyart">Bill Enyart</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Mike_Bost" title="Mike Bost">Mike Bost</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Nevada04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Nevada%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Nevada&#39;s 4th congressional district">Nevada&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Steven_Horsford" title="Steven Horsford">Steven Horsford</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Cresent_Hardy" title="Cresent Hardy">Cresent Hardy</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New Hampshire01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_Hampshire%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="New Hampshire&#39;s 1st congressional district">New Hampshire&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Carol_Shea-Porter" title="Carol Shea-Porter">Carol Shea-Porter</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Frank_Guinta" title="Frank Guinta">Frank Guinta</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 1st congressional district">New York&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Tim_Bishop" title="Tim Bishop">Tim Bishop</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Lee_Zeldin" title="Lee Zeldin">Lee Zeldin</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York24&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_24th_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 24th congressional district">New York&#160;24</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Dan_Maffei" title="Dan Maffei">Dan Maffei</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/John_Katko" title="John Katko">John Katko</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Texas23&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Texas%27s_23rd_congressional_district" title="Texas&#39;s 23rd congressional district">Texas&#160;23</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Pete_Gallego" title="Pete Gallego">Pete Gallego</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Will_Hurd" title="Will Hurd">Will Hurd</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="West Virginia03&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/West_Virginia%27s_3rd_congressional_district" title="West Virginia&#39;s 3rd congressional district">West Virginia&#160;3</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Nick_Rahall" title="Nick Rahall">Nick Rahall</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Evan_Jenkins_(politician)" title="Evan Jenkins (politician)">Evan Jenkins</a> (R).</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/American_Samoa%27s_at-large_congressional_district" title="American Samoa&#39;s at-large congressional district">American Samoa</a>: <a href="/wiki/Eni_Faleomavaega" title="Eni Faleomavaega">Eni Faleomavaega</a> (D) lost to <a href="/wiki/Amata_Coleman_Radewagen" title="Amata Coleman Radewagen">Amata Coleman Radewagen</a> (R).</i></li></ol>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Republicans_2">Republicans</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Republicans">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>Two Republicans lost re-election to Democrats.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Florida02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Florida&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Steve_Southerland_(Florida_politician)" title="Steve Southerland (Florida politician)">Steve Southerland</a> (R) lost to <a href="/wiki/Gwen_Graham" title="Gwen Graham">Gwen Graham</a> (D).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Nebraska02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Nebraska%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Nebraska&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Nebraska&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Lee_Terry" title="Lee Terry">Lee Terry</a> (R) lost to <a href="/wiki/Brad_Ashford" title="Brad Ashford">Brad Ashford</a> (D).</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Open_seat_gains">Open seat gains</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Open seat gains">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Republicans had a net gain of four seats previously held by Democrats.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Democratic_to_Republican">Democratic to Republican</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Democratic to Republican">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Five open seats previously held by Democrats were won by Republicans.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="Iowa01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Iowa%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Iowa&#39;s 1st congressional district">Iowa&#160;1</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Braley" title="Bruce Braley">Bruce Braley</a> (D) retired to run for U.S. Senate. Seat won by <a href="/wiki/Rod_Blum" title="Rod Blum">Rod Blum</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Maine02&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Maine%27s_2nd_congressional_district" title="Maine&#39;s 2nd congressional district">Maine&#160;2</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_Michaud" title="Mike Michaud">Mike Michaud</a> (D) retired to run for Governor of Maine. Seat won by <a href="/wiki/Bruce_Poliquin" title="Bruce Poliquin">Bruce Poliquin</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="New York21&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/New_York%27s_21st_congressional_district" title="New York&#39;s 21st congressional district">New York&#160;21</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Bill_Owens_(New_York_politician)" title="Bill Owens (New York politician)">Bill Owens</a> (D) retired. Seat won by <a href="/wiki/Elise_Stefanik" title="Elise Stefanik">Elise Stefanik</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="North Carolina07&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/North_Carolina%27s_7th_congressional_district" title="North Carolina&#39;s 7th congressional district">North Carolina&#160;7</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Mike_McIntyre" title="Mike McIntyre">Mike McIntyre</a> (D) retired. Seat won by <a href="/wiki/David_Rouzer" title="David Rouzer">David Rouzer</a> (R).</li>
<li><span data-sort-value="Utah04&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Utah%27s_4th_congressional_district" title="Utah&#39;s 4th congressional district">Utah&#160;4</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Jim_Matheson" title="Jim Matheson">Jim Matheson</a> (D) retired. Seat won by <a href="/wiki/Mia_Love" title="Mia Love">Mia Love</a> (R).</li></ol>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Republican_to_Democratic">Republican to Democratic</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Republican to Democratic">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>One open seat previously held by a Republican was won by a Democrat.
</p>
<ol><li><span data-sort-value="California31&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/California%27s_31st_congressional_district" title="California&#39;s 31st congressional district">California&#160;31</a></span>: <a href="/wiki/Gary_Miller" title="Gary Miller">Gary Miller</a> (R) retired. Seat won by <a href="/wiki/Pete_Aguilar" title="Pete Aguilar">Pete Aguilar</a> (D).</li></ol>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Close_races">Close races</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Close races">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Where the margin was less than ten percent.
</p>
<ol><li><span style="color:red;">Arizona 2nd, 0.1% Flipped (R)</span></li>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Competitive_districts">Competitive districts</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Competitive districts">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg/220px-US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg.png" decoding="async" width="220" height="128" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg/330px-US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg/440px-US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1242" data-file-height="720" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:US_House_2014_competitive_seats.svg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Competitive seats highlighted by party.<br /> <b>Democratic-held seats</b>: <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#008; color:#008;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Competitive</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#ccf; color:#ccf;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Uncompetitive</span><br /> <b>Republican-held seats</b>: <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#800; color:#800;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Competitive</span> <span style="margin:0px; font-size:90%;"><span style="border:none; background-color:#fcc; color:#fcc;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span>&#160;Uncompetitive</span></div></div></div>
<p>The following are the predictions for House districts where at least one out of the <a href="/wiki/Cook_Political_Report" class="mw-redirect" title="Cook Political Report">Cook Political Report</a>, <a href="/wiki/Daily_Kos" title="Daily Kos">Daily Kos Elections</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Rothenberg_Political_Report" class="mw-redirect" title="Rothenberg Political Report">Rothenberg Political Report</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sabato%27s_Crystal_Ball" title="Sabato&#39;s Crystal Ball">Sabato's Crystal Ball</a> and <a href="/wiki/Real_Clear_Politics" class="mw-redirect" title="Real Clear Politics">Real Clear Politics</a> did not agree that the district was "safe Democratic" or "safe Republican." Incumbents not running for re-election have parentheses around their names, while incumbents with a caret (^) sought re-election, but were defeated in the primary election. Note that safeness of a district is not necessarily a prediction as to outcome.
</p><p>195 seats were viewed as "safe Republican" and 159 as "safe Democratic" by all five of these sources.
</p><p>Voters had the choice of only one major political party in more than one in six U.S. House elections nationwide, including more than one in four races in the Southern region.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-49">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup>
</p>

</th>
<th><a href="/wiki/Cook_Partisan_Voting_Index" title="Cook Partisan Voting Index">CPVI</a>
</th>
<th>Incumbent
</th>

</th>

</th>
<th>Daily Kos Elections<br /><small>(November 4, 2014)</small><sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup>
</th>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Special_elections">Special elections</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Special elections">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Five special elections were held in 2014.
</p>
<ul><li>Two elections were held concurrent with the November elections. The winners received a <a href="/wiki/List_of_current_members_of_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_by_seniority" class="mw-redirect" title="List of current members of the United States House of Representatives by seniority">seniority advantage</a> over other freshmen, as their seniority starts on the day of the elections.</li>
<li>Three elections were held separate from the November general elections.</li></ul>
<table class="wikitable">


<tbody><tr>
<th rowspan="2">District
</th>
<th colspan="3">Incumbent
</th>
<th colspan="2">This race
</th></tr>
<tr>
<th>Representative
</th>
<th>Party
</th>
<th>First elected
</th>
<th>Results
</th>
<th>Candidates
</th></tr>
<tr>
<td><span data-sort-value="Florida13&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Florida%27s_13th_congressional_district" title="Florida&#39;s 13th congressional district">Florida&#160;13</a></span>
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/Bill_Young" title="Bill Young">Bill Young</a>
</td>
<td style="background-color:#FFB6B6">Republican
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/1970_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Florida" class="mw-redirect" title="1970 United States House of Representatives elections in Florida">1970</a>
</td>
<td style="background:#DDDDDD">Incumbent died October 18, 2013, having already announced his retiretment.<sup id="cite_ref-Young_55-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Young-55">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup><br />New member <a href="/wiki/2014_Florida%27s_13th_congressional_district_special_election" title="2014 Florida&#39;s 13th congressional district special election">elected</a> <b>March 11, 2014</b>.<br />Republican hold.<br />Successor was later elected to the next term, <a href="#Florida">see below</a>.
</td>
<td nowrap=""><div class="plainlist">
<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/David_Jolly" title="David Jolly">David Jolly</a></b> (Republican) 48.4%</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Alex_Sink" title="Alex Sink">Alex Sink</a> (Democratic) 46.6%</li>
<li><a href="/w/index.php?title=Lucas_Overby&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Lucas Overby (page does not exist)">Lucas Overby</a> (Libertarian) 4.8%</li></ul>
</div>
</td></tr>
<tr>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Indiana">Indiana</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=30" title="Edit section: Indiana">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<th><span data-sort-value="Indiana01&#160;!"><a href="/wiki/Indiana%27s_1st_congressional_district" title="Indiana&#39;s 1st congressional district">Indiana&#160;1</a></span>
</th>
<td style="background-color:#B0CEFF"><span data-sort-value="090&#160;!">D+10</span>
</td>
<td><a href="/wiki/Pete_Visclosky" title="Pete Visclosky">Pete Visclosky</a>

<td>Incumbent re-elected.

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=37" title="Edit section: Massachusetts">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Massachusetts" title="2014 United States House of Representatives elections in Massachusetts">2014 United States House of Representatives elections in Massachusetts</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_Representatives_from_Massachusetts" title="List of United States Representatives from Massachusetts">List of United States Representatives from Massachusetts</a></div>
<table class="wikitable sortable">


<tbody><tr valign="bottom">

<ul><li><img alt="Green tick" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/13px-Green_check.svg.png" decoding="async" width="13" height="13" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/20px-Green_check.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/03/Green_check.svg/26px-Green_check.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="600" /><span style="display:none">Y</span> <b><a href="/wiki/Bonnie_Watson_Coleman" title="Bonnie Watson Coleman">Bonnie Watson Coleman</a></b> (Democratic) 61.0%</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Alieta_Eck" class="mw-redirect" title="Alieta Eck">Alieta Eck</a> (Republican) 36.5%</li>

</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<td><a href="/wiki/2004_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections_in_Pennsylvania" title="2004 United States House of Representatives elections in Pennsylvania">2004</a>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Non-voting_delegates">Non-voting delegates</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=67" title="Edit section: Non-voting delegates">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_American_Samoa" class="mw-redirect" title="2014 United States House of Representatives election in American Samoa">2014 United States House of Representatives election in American Samoa</a>, <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_Guam" title="2014 United States House of Representatives election in Guam">2014 United States House of Representatives election in Guam</a>, <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_the_District_of_Columbia" title="2014 United States House of Representatives election in the District of Columbia">2014 United States House of Representatives election in the District of Columbia</a>, <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_the_Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="2014 United States House of Representatives election in the Northern Mariana Islands">2014 United States House of Representatives election in the Northern Mariana Islands</a>, and <a href="/wiki/2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_election_in_the_United_States_Virgin_Islands" title="2014 United States House of Representatives election in the United States Virgin Islands">2014 United States House of Representatives election in the United States Virgin Islands</a></div>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_Delegates_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_from_American_Samoa" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from American Samoa">List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from American Samoa</a>, <a href="/wiki/List_of_Delegates_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_from_Guam" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from Guam">List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from Guam</a>, <a href="/wiki/List_of_Delegates_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_from_the_District_of_Columbia" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the District of Columbia">List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the District of Columbia</a>, <a href="/wiki/List_of_Delegates_to_the_United_States_House_of_Representatives_from_the_United_States_Virgin_Islands" class="mw-redirect" title="List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the United States Virgin Islands">List of Delegates to the United States House of Representatives from the United States Virgin Islands</a>, and <a href="/wiki/United_States_congressional_delegations_from_the_Northern_Mariana_Islands" title="United States congressional delegations from the Northern Mariana Islands">United States congressional delegations from the Northern Mariana Islands</a></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=2014_United_States_House_of_Representatives_elections&amp;action=edit&amp;section=69" title="Edit section: Notes">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In addition, five of the six <a href="/wiki/Delegate_(United_States_Congress)" class="mw-redirect" title="Delegate (United States Congress)">non-voting delegates</a> in the U.S. House of Representatives were elected.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

	<h2>Navigation menu</h2>
	<div id="mw-head">

	 >
	<h3 id="p-personal-label">
		<span>Personal tools</span>
	</h3>
	<div class="vector-menu-content">
